snippet: A group of civil rights organizations and legal ethicists filed a complaint of misconduct against Judge Edith H. Jones of the United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit.
abstract: Group of civil rights organizations and legal ethicists file complaint of misconduct against Judge Edith H Jones of Houston, who sits on United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit, accusing her of racial bias; complaint claims that recent remarks made by Jones in speech at University of Pennsylvania Law School show bias against minority groups and inappropriate religious belief in death penalty.
lead_paragraph: A group of civil rights organizations and legal ethicists filed a complaint of misconduct against Judge Edith H. Jones of the United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit.

headline.seo: Federal Judge in Texas Is Accused of Racial Bias
headline.main: Complaint Accuses U.S. Judge in Texas of Racial Bias
headline.print_headline: Complaint Accuses U.S. Judge in Texas of Racial Bias
